title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\ResourcePolicy
name: ResourcePolicy
description:
Represents a Resource Policy resource. You can use resource policies to schedule actions for some Compute Engine resources. For example, you can use them to schedule persistent disk snapshots.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.ResourcePolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the resource, provided by the client when initially creating the resource. The resource name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.description: [Output Only] The system status of the resource policy.

params.name: data.snapshot_schedule_policy
params.description: Resource policy for persistent disks for creating snapshots.

params.description: [Output Only] The status of resource policy creation. Check the Status enum for the list of possible values.
